MASTER O Today at 00:39
Hello Alaskaneagle77,

Unfortunately, our system does not allow modification of leaves, losses, or Elo. The system was built this way in an effort to prevent corruption. We are, however, working to better accommodate for disconnects and server stability.

Please note that while sometimes losses are prevented when our servers encounter a large scale issue, this is done proactively and at the time of any server complications. Losses cannot be removed retroactively. If you were involved in a game that ended prematurely because of large scale server issues, your losses would have been prevented.

If you believe this leave was the result of a bug in our system, we can explore the issue if you provide us with a copy of your r3d logs. R3d logs will help us figure out where the problem originated. Our Knowledge Base will explain how to find these logs; you can attach them to this ticket in your response.

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674#jwq7

If you are experiencing consistent network issues or crashes, let me know and I can help you troubleshoot them. I still won't have a way to alter your record, but hopefully we can reduce the chance of this happening in the future.

Master O 
Player Support Specialist 
The Wandering Master

Hey alaskaneagle,

I won't mince words here; the responses you received fully sucked.  While actual real-human Rioters responded to you, they did not properly read or comprehend your issue clearly.  We are going to be reaching out to these specialists and make sure they realize their mistake and work to make sure this doesn't happen again in the future.

I made sure that your ticket was properly escalated to our Tech Team.  They can help work with you directly to help resolve any issue you may still have once you have completed your move!

Let me know if I can help out in any way!

This is far from rare.  Many of my tickets have been repeatedly responded to so inaccurately that I assumed there was no way a human being actually read my ticket and typed this.  If every single ticket is handled by an actual human being, then you guys really need to do a quality check on your employees.  Many of them seem to be skimming mostly titles of tickets and ignoring explanations.  They just copy-paste a seemingly random section of a FAQ and move on.

Perhaps you should talk to all your specialist then because most of the time that I have used support the first response shows they didnt even read my concern. It is always just a canned generic response about some other issue.

You could start by telling them that step 1 is actually taking the time to READ that which the player took the the time to write to them.

From my experience what the OP experienced is the norm not he exception.

So I've actually had the same problem before with ridiculous "Riot bot" answers; last season, when there was a huge problem with the Mac client crashing on League, I sent a ticket to Support that got responded to pretty quickly. The only problem was, they kept addressing my problem as if I had a Windows system when in fact I told them MULTIPLE times that I was playing on a Mac system. The subject line said it, the ticket said it, and I just couldn't understand why they kept telling me I needed to follow steps for my "Windows" system for like 4 times in a row.

Finally I guess it got through to someone who actually understood how to read emails, and a Rioter gave me the proper info on how to help my Mac problem.

Point in case? Riot really REALLY needs to hire better people for Support. I mean this more as feedback of a bad experience than a "Let's diss Riot"-a-thon. Cuz I love Riot. :)

nice bots riot

good to see that the money thrown at you by consumer sheep were not wasted
After the red post, I'd guess it's human rioters who read your ticket, then respond, and that, if they choose, there are a bunch of pre-written answers they can use or modify.

> "Client glitch and I got booted from the select menu and your system treated it as a dodge"

Do you consistently experience problems with this or was it a one time thing? 

Player Support cannot remove queue dodge penalties from your account, intentional or not. The system also won't be able to differentiate between getting disconnect due to a glitch or other error and intentionally leaving. This is because you could just as easily unplug your modem and avoid getting penalized. 

If you have consistent issues with this, my advice would be to follow through with your player support request and give them the information they need to help you.
